introduction: Basil is a fragrant herb, easy to grow in pots or gardens. It loves warmth and sun.

sections.title: 1. Planting
sections.content: Start seeds indoors or sow directly after the last frost. Basil also propagates easily from cuttings. Space plants about 10-12 inches apart.

sections.title: 2. Sunlight & Location
sections.content: Basil thrives in full sun (6+ hours). It can tolerate some light shade but flavor may be less intense.

sections.title: 3. Watering
sections.content: Water regularly to keep the soil consistently moist, but not waterlogged. Water at the base of the plant.

sections.title: 4. Soil & Fertilizing
sections.content: Use well-draining, rich soil. Basil generally doesn't need heavy fertilization; a light feed of compost or balanced liquid fertilizer once or twice during the growing season is usually enough.

sections.title: 5. Pruning & Harvesting
sections.content: Pinch off the tips of branches regularly to encourage bushier growth and prevent flowering (which can make leaves bitter). Harvest leaves as needed.
